message: Fixing Canalysis_deriv
body:
MVT uses notions from the standard library whilst it is easier
  for us to produce evidence for notions from Coqtail.
  Ranalysis_MVT is basically repackaging MVT. It is rather tricky
  hence the definition of Ranalysis_extend extending a function
  defined on an interval by continuity.

  Lots of small lemmatas were needed to prove this theorems. They
  have been dispatched in various files.

author: gallais@7194d10d-a3ed-4628-aea2-7b4a0dfde000
message: arctan as a power series
body:
- Definition of arctan as a power series throught reduction of
the argument and oddity equations.

- Neat (and short!) proof that arctan is derivable on D(0,1)
with value / (1 + x ^ 2) and extension to the whole R+ \ 1.

- Proof that arctan and atan are equal on D(0,1). To get the
proof that atan 1 = arctan 1 (necessary to prove sin PI/2 = 1
but also to unlock atan == arctan on the whole real line), we
need to prove that arctan is continuous in 1.

There's a mediocre proof in my L3 internship but we can probably
find something more general / cleaner. Is it true that if the
power series converges on a point on the edge of the disk then
the function "sum" is continuous at this point (R case only of
course!). i.e. is this goal solvable?

An  : Rseq
r   : R
rho : finite_cv_radius An r
l   : R
Hl  : Rpser An r l
==========================================
continuity_pt_in (interval 0 r) (sum_r An r rho) r



git-svn-id: svn+ssh://svn.code.sf.net/p/coqtail/code@400 7194d10d-a3ed-4628-aea2-7b4a0dfde000

author: gallais@7194d10d-a3ed-4628-aea2-7b4a0dfde000
message: cleaning and splitting Ranalysis_*
body:
- Rinterval's Rball does not require a proof that its radius
  is positive anymore: it was causing lots of trouble for no
  particular advantage.
  NB: one can prove that 0 < radius as soon as there is an
  element inside the Rball...
  As a consequence, continuity_Rball, derivable_Rball,
  increasing_Rball, etc. also get rid of the extra argument.

- Factorisation of (strictly_)(in/de)creasing_in and other
  (in/sur)jective_in-like concepts which allows us to remove
  numerous useless theorems (strictly_increasing_in already
  implies injective_in: no need for a special statement for
  strictly_increasing_open_interval!).

- New files: the annoyingly obese Ranalysis_facts has been
  cut into 4 pieces with names stating explicitly what they
  contain. These files contain more comments and are internally
  quite well-organized. I'd dare to say that Ranalysis_* is
  almost release-ready (modulo the TODOs).

- Porting ALL the old files to the new interface. I can
  guarantee it: this is not the funniest stuff to do...

- TODOs: lots of stuff tagged as TODO (mainly "move this!")

author: gallais@7194d10d-a3ed-4628-aea2-7b4a0dfde000
message: sine, cosine, arctan are sums of Rseq_zip
body:
sine, cosine and arctan are now defined as power series based on
the Rseq_zip of 0 and something else. Thanks to this:

- proof of equality between our versions and the ones from the
  stdlib are quite trivial because of the intermediate lemmas:
  sum (Rseq_zip An 0) x = sum An (x ^ 2)
  sum (Rseq_zip 0 An) x = x * sum An (x ^ 2)

- the proof that arctan's convergence radius is 1 is far simpler
  thanks to the properties of Rseq_zip

author: gallais@7194d10d-a3ed-4628-aea2-7b4a0dfde000
message: First steps towards giving an explicit formula for arctan's derivative defined as a power series:
body:
- quick remainder of the value of sum_k x^k
- proving that given two Rseq An and Bn of convergence radius r,
  interleaving them yields back an Rseq of convergence radius
  the square root of r.

The next step is to prove that interleaving [An] and [0] is the
same as composing with [Rsqr] (or composing with [Rsqr] and then
multiplying the sum by [x] depending whether we consider
[Rseq_zip An 0] or [Rseq_zip 0 An]).

6) Only admit remaining: prime_rect. FUCK THE POLICE and the standard library.

author: gallais@7194d10d-a3ed-4628-aea2-7b4a0dfde000
message: Introducing: classes on restriction to balls. This is however really experimental and will probably change in the near future.
body:
A couple of remarks:

- the continuity is really cleanly defined (continuity_pt,
continue_in, limit1_in, limit_in) whereas the derivability
is somehow ad-hoc and non modular

- continuity_Rball will probably stay unchanged (apart from
D_x that should maybe be removed): when we talk about the
continuity inside a ball, we consider only points inside this
ball (thanks to continue_in).

- modifying interval_continuity in the same fashion would break
RIVT and I do not want to have to fix it right now. But it would
make sense to do the same (or develop a similar and somehow cleaner
library for continuity_Rball and then use conversions between
continuity_Rball and interval_continuity to retrieve the results).

message: Ltac code to normalize the goal after quoting it. The basic idea is to:
body:
1. quote the goal as a diff_equa E and an environment ENV
2. normalize the goal so that it is equal to [| E |]R ENV
3. apply our lemma
4. profit

Following one of the remarks from the anonymous
referees: you cannot really talk about reflection
unless you are able to reify your goal.

Optimizations can be discussed:

- the fact that we do not care about the shape of the
[infinite_cv_radius an] proof
- the fact that we do not care about the shape of the
[C n (sum an rho)] proof (shouldn't we use [D n] instead
of [C n]?! Scandal!)
- the fact that [isconst s x] is a depth-first from right
to left algorithm

By the way: nothing new but debugging Ltac in a shell is
really a pain in the ass.

body:
==============================
========= New things =========
==============================

All the modifications are done in order to have shorter proofs by
reflecting the structure behind the objects.

-- gt_pser, gt_abs_pser, An_deriv, etc. are defined in terms of
operations on Rsequences. Rpser_def_simpl gives rewriting rules
on these new abstractions;

-- Partial power series are special objects (Rseq_pps) defined using
Rseq_sum and gt_pser;

-- We do not rely on Un_cv, infinite_sum, Pser, etc. anymore except
for the RFsequence part which should be modified;

==============================
========== Updates ===========
==============================

-- everything in Rpser is up-to-date;

-- some parts of Cpser have been made compilable but the code is
really ugly and does not use the new ideas;

==============================
====== Broken libraries ======
==============================

I have updated a lot of things this week-end but there was too
much to do. Most of the time adding a couple of [unfold],
modifying the [Require Import] list to add the new libraries
and changing the names that have changed  is sufficient.
Sometimes it is more subtle (e.g. on the complex where there are
collisions between IRC / Cmult / Rmult).

-- RTaylor, RStirling, Rzeta2, Triangular, Wallis are broken

-- Cexp is broken;



========================= Everything else =========================

-- README records the revision number before the update (where
everything works fine)

-- Differential equations can now contain a multiplication by a
constant

-- mytheories contains new stuff (nothing fancy)

-- Rsequence_rewrite_facts is basically lemmas that should maybe
be moved somewhere appropriate

message: vous avez le droit de LIRE TOUT CA, c'est pas au script de commit que je parle.
body:
1. Rapprox: approximation d'un reel par la suite des rationnels
floor(x*2^n)/2^n et preuve de la convergence. il reste des
trucs arithmetiques, notamment sur les "positive" mais bon
peut-etre que floor(x/n+1)/n+1 est plus adapte, mais c'est
moins joli je trouve, comme approximation.

2. plein d'admits sur Rle au lieu de Rlt. Si vous commencez a 
n'etre pas d'accord avec mes conv. de nommages [1], manifestez 
vous. si vous voulez faire des admits, pas de probleme, mais
prevenez moi avant, que je ne m'embete pas. normalement je
commite mes trucs meme s'ils sont petits, histoire d'eviter 
qu'on se marche sur les pattes (meme si pim a apparemment 
decide de laisser tomber).

3. toujours des problemes de ring, je ne sais vraiment pas
d'ou ca vient. si ca tente quelqu'un. il y a aussi les trucs
de rewrite sous Rlt, mais je ne sais plus si ca vient du fait
que Rlt n'est pas reconnu comme une relation car de type
R -> R -> Type.

[1] conv de nommage pour les trucs de compatibilite:
Rop_prop_compat_loc, avec :
- op: le truc qui fait le changement (e.g. add, mul, eq[2])
- prop: le truc qui est stable par op (e.g. eq, lt, cv)
- loc: l, r, ou rien. (et le rien, c'est parfois a la fois
  l et r)

[2] eq peut faire un changement, par exemple, Req_lt_compat_r
c'est lt qui est compatible avec l'egalite a droite. Et du 
coup les trucs comme Rx_x_compat_l/r ou x c'est une relation,
c'est Rx_trans

message: MESSAGE DE LOG IMPORTANT
body:
debut de l'axiomatique, version mise sur le svn pour pouvoir 
y travailler a plusieurs.

Toute remarque est bienvenue, notamment sur des suggestions de 
noms de fichiers, de modules, de repertoires. Pour l'instant, 
pour des raisons pratique, j'ai essaye de faire une intersection
vide avec les noms de la stdlib.

Pour l'instant:
src/Fresh : tout dans la nouvelle axiomatique.
Raxiom.v : les axiomes minimaux (oui, j'ai enleve le 's', mais 
j'ai pas trouve mieux)

tous les lemmes de verifications ne sont pas prouves, donc il est
possible qu'il manque des axiomes.

de même, les axiomes ne sont pas encore habites. On fera dans 
l'avenir immediat :
 - stdlib |- coqtail's reals
 - coqtail's reals + EM + choice |- inhabited (stdlib)

ou "inhabited" est la fameuse monade qui parle non-constructivement 
de formules constructives, qui se reduit au demon a l'extraction
   Par exemple : ex f -> inhabited (sig f)
Cf une explication qui viendra un peu plus tard.

Et dans un avenir moins immediat, la meme chose avec C-Corn, mais 
en precisant peut-etre des conditions necessaires. (mais je ne pense
a rien maintenant qui ne suffit pas a modeliser C-Corn)

author: gallais@7194d10d-a3ed-4628-aea2-7b4a0dfde000
message: 2 important modifications:
body:
- Rpser_facts: derivatives are now expressed with sums (and not weaksums)

TODO:
-- prove a small proof when the convergence radius is finite



- C_n: (C : nat -> (R -> R) -> Prop) becomes (C : nat -> (R -> R) -> Set) (and C_infty is now of type (R -> R) -> Type)

GREAT BECAUSE:
-- similar to derivable
-- allow us to perform case analysis on (C (S n) f) proofs to construct the nth derivative
BUT:
-- the use of inversion in derive (which is a Fixpoint and not just a lemma) produces a huge lambda-term (use J.F. Monin trick?) (cf. the forthcoming summary of Edinburgh's adventures)
-- still not sure whether it is the best way to do it

setoids are not good for us... even if my goal was to show
how convenient they are :).

actually quite fun. The last two proofs are a good exercise :)).

body:
Note that Ranalysis5_clean is a temporary name because I will add other lemmas (more general ones) to create the "real" Ranalysis5 file.

Next step : cleaning Rpser (by adding useful sublemmas) and (if there is enough time) modifying Ratan to define atan with a power serie.
